intro: Valerianella pomelii, commonly known as the sweet cicely or garden valerian, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist, shaded environments. Valerianella pomelii is known for its aromatic leaves and has been used historically in herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
